title: Domain of a function
summary: In mathematics, the domain of a function is the set of inputs accepted by the function. It is sometimes denoted by dom ⁡ ( f ) {\displaystyle \operatorname {dom} (f)} or dom ⁡ f {\displaystyle \operatorname {dom} f} , where f is the function. In simpler terms, the laymen explanation of the domain of a function can generally be thought of as "what can x be". [1]
